briefTitle: Study of the Safety & Efficacy of Intravenous Acetaminophen in Pediatric Inpatients
officialTitle: A Phase III Multi-Center, Open-Label, Prospective, Repeated Dose, Multi-Day Study of the Safety & Efficacy of Intravenous Acetaminophen in Pediatric Inpatients.
summary: Intravenous acetaminophen (IVAPAP) is safe in repeated dose, multi-day clinical use when administered at a daily dose of 40 to 75 mg/kg body weight

primaryOutcome.measure: Number of Subjects Reporting at Least One Treatment Emergent Adverse Event (TEAE)
primaryOutcome.timeFrame: First dose to end of treatment period

effectByArm.arm: Neonates (<= 28 Days Old): IV APAP 10 - 15 mg/kg q8h
Infants (29 Days to 1 Year Old): IV APAP 10 - 15 mg/kg q6h
Children (2 to < 12 Years Old): IV APAP 6.7 - 12.5 mg/kg q4h
Children (2 to < 12 Years Old): IV APAP 10 - 15 mg/kg q6h
Adolescents (12 to <= 16 Years): IV APAP 6.7 - 12.5 mg/kg q4h
Adolescents (12 to <= 16 Years Old): IV APAP 10 - 15 mg/kg q6h
Infants (12 to < 24 Months): IV APAP 6.7 - 12.5 mg/kg q4h
Infants (12 to < 24 Months): IV APAP 10 - 15 mg/kg q6h
